data.title: Best Christian Colleges in North Carolina 2024
data.meta_description: Which are the best Christian colleges in North Carolina? The best Christian schools in the United States align Christian faith with academic excellence.
data.text:

Duke University

Tuition: $63K

Davidson College

Tuition: $57K

Tuition: $16K

Queens University of Charlotte

Tuition: $41K

Greensboro College

Tuition: $20K

Key Takeaways

The Council for Christian Colleges and Universities (CCCU) accredits 24 Christ-centered Christian colleges in North Carolina.

A Christian college is a perfect place to learn more about God while gaining knowledge and developing professionally.

There are many reasons students prefer to attend a Christian college in North Carolina, but everything boils down to one major thing: commitment to a community and an institution centered on God and the Scripture.

Table of Contents

Christian Education for College Undergrads in North Carolina

Last year, North Carolina was home to more than 18,000 international students. After all, this state has it all: some of the most beautiful beaches on the east coast, picturesque mountains on the west, lively cities in the central part, and the largest research park in America, the Research Triangle Park.

North Carolina also has a low cost of living, which makes the state one of the top choices for college students.

Why Attend a Christian College

While there are many college choices for undergrads and graduate students in North Carolina, some college students prefer to enroll in a Christian college. Aside from offering a great education, why is a Christian college generally a good option for post-secondary education?

Choosing which college to attend is a huge decision. Here are some reasons students opt to attend a Christian college.

A Christian college helps grow your faith. Attending church services on campus, being exposed to a Christian curriculum, getting access to Christian advisors, and building your Christian worldview through what you learn and are exposed to are all important components of a Christian education.

In most secular colleges, you will be faced with different and opposing worldviews that may not align with your Christian beliefs. Enrolling in a Christian college means your faith-based values are likely incorporated into each class. Better yet, your professors and classmates hold the same spiritual values that you do.

A Christian college will also offer majors that may not be available in secular colleges, such as those focused on ministry or Christian counseling. If you want to pursue a career in a Christian field, attending a top-ranked Christian college in North Carolina is a great choice.

The following list of the best Christian schools consists entirely of colleges and universities that offer four-year undergraduate degrees. Weâve identified 24 Christian colleges in North Carolina. In order to be included in this ranking list of best Christian colleges and universities, a school must self-identify as Christian, be fully accredited, and offer a broad range of bachelor degree programs.

Best Christian Colleges in North Carolina

#1

Duke University

Durham , NC

Duke University is a top-tier research university in Durham. Founded by the Quakers in 1838, it is known worldwide for both standout academics and strong athletics.

What we love about Duke University:

Duke is easily one of the top universities in the state, whether public or private.

Duke University is ideal for students who:

Are intelligent, has clear goals in sight, and driven.

Duke University may not be ideal for students who:

Donât have the work ethic to dedicate to rigorous academic work.

High Point University, opened by the Methodists in 1924, is the spiritual successor to Yadkin College (1857-1924). With over 5,800 students, it offers over 120 undergraduate majors & minors and 18 graduate majors.

What we love about High Point University:

It is a blend of excellent academics, a beautiful campus, and a very livable host city.

High Point University is ideal for students who:

Prefer small class sizes and more attention from professors.

High Point University may not be ideal for students who:

Might want to be in a more bustling/urban campus.

2021 Ranking Archive

Many of our 2024 undergraduate focused rankings look considerably different than 2023. Thatâs because we took a fundamentally different approach. For 2024 we utilized our Concentrated Influence algorithm, designed to take away the size advantage larger schools have when we rank their faculty and alumniâs academic influence. Concentrated influence highlights smaller schools that are proportionally as successful as larger universities at cultivating influential alumni and faculty.
